abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Sector Adjustment
            Credit Project will support the government's
            medium-term Agricultural Sector Modernization and
            Development Program which is designed to:  (a) improve land
            use by supporting modifications to the Agrarian Reform Law
            (LRA) to secure land property rights, support the
            development of land markets and consolidate the process of
            the agrarian reform; (b) lay the basis for a sustainable
            management of the country's rich forest resources by
            improving forestry property rights and reorienting the role
            of the public forestry sector towards the protection and
            management of the forest and the promotion of biodiversity
            conservation; and (c) help improve sector planning and
            coordination by strengthening and making better use of the
            budgeting process.  It will also consolidate reforms in
            trade, agricultural pricing policy, grain marketing, and
            rural finance implemented during 1990-1992 and supported by
            the Second Structural Adjustment Loan.
